_metadata.description: Pre-approved discount policies - Approved by Revenue Management & Customer Experience teams

GOODWILL_RECOVERY.name: Goodwill Recovery Discount
GOODWILL_RECOVERY.description: Applied when customer had recent service issue to rebuild relationship
GOODWILL_RECOVERY.notes: Protects high-value customer relationships after service failures

PRICE_SENSITIVE_HIGH.name: High Price Sensitivity Discount
PRICE_SENSITIVE_HIGH.description: Applied to price-sensitive customers to improve conversion
PRICE_SENSITIVE_HIGH.notes: Without discount, conversion rate drops significantly

PRICE_SENSITIVE_MEDIUM.name: Medium Price Sensitivity Discount
PRICE_SENSITIVE_MEDIUM.description: Small incentive for moderately price-sensitive customers
PRICE_SENSITIVE_MEDIUM.notes: Optional - apply only if needed for conversion

LOYALTY_APPRECIATION.name: Loyalty Tier Appreciation
LOYALTY_APPRECIATION.description: Thank-you discount for top-tier loyalty members
LOYALTY_APPRECIATION.notes: Stackable with other discounts up to segment max

NO_DISCOUNT.name: No Discount (Standard Pricing)
NO_DISCOUNT.description: Full price when no discount triggers apply
NO_DISCOUNT.notes: Default policy when customer shows no price sensitivity

segment_caps._description: Maximum total discount allowed per customer segment (cannot exceed even with stacked policies)

elite_business.reason: High lifetime value justifies protecting relationship

high_value_leisure.reason: Good customers but more price elastic

budget_leisure.reason: Price sensitive but still need margin protection
